summary: The concept of "flexitime," redirected to "flexible working hours," pertains to the organization of work and working conditions within the EU legal framework. Flexible working hours allow employees to adjust their work schedules, promoting a balance between professional and personal commitments. This regulatory approach aims to enhance job satisfaction, productivity, and overall well-being. The EU has recognized the importance of flexible working arrangements, particularly in directives that support work-life balance and gender equality. By fostering such adaptability in work environments, the EU seeks to respond to evolving labor market demands and improve the quality of life for its workforce.
